tasks.task: Install and operate a drip irrigation system on a farmstead.
subtasks: Connect drip tubing to an outdoor spigot equipped with a built-in back pressure valve.
Install a timer for the system to prevent over-watering and increase efficiency.
Set up a screen filter and pressure regulator to maintain water flow and system performance.
Route mainline drip tubing to various garden areas, using T-taps and inline emitters as needed.
Distribute water to individual plants via emitters or by extending drip tape lengths.
Use the system to water container gardens, raised beds, and fruit trees.
Crimp drip tape ends or plug mainline tubing as appropriate for each irrigation zone.
Monitor and adjust the system as necessary to accommodate different plant water needs and garden layout changes.

tasks.task: Maintain and troubleshoot a drip irrigation system.
subtasks: Regularly check for and replace clogged filters to ensure clean water flow.
Inspect system components for damage or wear and make repairs as needed.
Adjust pressure regulators to maintain optimal water pressure (4-10 psi) for efficient operation.
Identify and correct issues such as inconsistent watering patterns or poorly placed emitters.
Flush the system periodically to prevent buildup of minerals or debris.

tasks.task: Adapt a drip irrigation system for different growing conditions and needs.
subtasks: Modify the system to connect to rain barrels or gravitational water sources.
Replace standard emitters with variable rate emitters for more precise watering.
Shift water distribution to accommodate different crop rotations or garden expansion.
Implement water-saving practices such as using mulch or improving soil structure to reduce watering frequency.
